description: Define {b(n)} by b(1)=3, b(n) (n >= 2) is smallest number such that b(1)^2+...+b(n)^2 = m^2 for some m and all b(i) are distinct. Sequence gives values of m.
comments: Also: Begin with the least length of a Pythagorean Triangle (PT), a(1)=3. Then a(n) is the least hypotenuse of a PT which has a(n-1) as one of its legs. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 17 2014
